channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: What happened on 22 August
item.description: Six new cases of Covid-19 in the community were announced today, NZ Post has stood down staff at a facility linked to two positive cases, and STA Travel has shut down owing thousands to other tourism agencies.

item.title: Bus passenger might have passed on Covid-19 to another
item.description: Two people later diagnosed with Covid-19 travelled on the same Auckland bus.

item.title: Covid-19: Six new cases in the community in New Zealand today
item.description: There are six new cases of Covid-19 in the community and nine people in hospital with the coronavirus, including three in intensive care, the Health Ministry has revealed.

item.title: Body found in search for missing Auckland boatie
item.description: Police say a body has been found in the search for a missing boatie in the Auckland region.

item.title: Postal staff stand down after co-workers' positive tests
item.description: NZ Post has stood down staff who worked the day shift at an Auckland parcel processing centre after two positive tests linked to the facility.

item.title: Driver jailed after spitting in cell, claiming to have Covid
item.description: A man who rammed a police car and wiped saliva on officers, while claiming to have Covid-19, has been jailed for a year.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand for 22 August
item.description: Three people are now in intensive care units in New Zealand hospitals because of Covid-19, the Health Ministry has revealed. See how the rest of the day developed with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Marylands School abuse inquiry: 'It's about time'
item.description: A victim of abuse at Marylands School in Christchurch says a new investigation is overdue but he hopes it will result in justice.

item.title: Wellington police arrest 3 people after drugs, firearms seized
item.description: Three people have been arrested and drugs, firearms, cash and jewellery have been seized in a police raid in the Wellington suburb of Tawa.

item.title: Suicide commentary unhelpful to Queenstown, mental health experts say
item.description: Speculation about the financial impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the suicide rate is causing more harm than good, those in the mental health sector say.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 21 August
item.description: The prime minister had a serious message for those blaming people for being infected with the virus, the use of masks is once again being urged, and the financial hit in the second period of restrictions amid the outbreak is becoming apparent.

item.title: Canterbury DHB remains quiet on Friday as doctors call for government intervention
item.description: Seven members of DHB's executive team have resigned since July, and one spoke out today pointing to the "adversarial" attitude of the board members as her reason for exiting.

item.title: Food parcel demand back at lockdown-scale levels in Auckland
item.description: Auckland City Missioner Chris Farrelly says they are handing out about 1200 food parcels a week - three times the number they would have done in a normal week, before Covid-19.

item.title: $5m Lotto ticket left in glovebox for a week while winners were oblivious
item.description: An Invercargill couple who won a $5 million share of last weekend's massive Powerball prize kept the ticket in their car's glovebox, oblivious to how much it was worth.

item.title: Transmission Gully: Govt orders review, NZTA says there are 'lessons to learn'
item.description: The NZTA says it has learnt lessons with $1.25 billion of taxpayers money used to build Wellington highway Transmission Gully as the government orders the project be reviewed.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates on Friday 21 August
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says NZ's alert levels will not be lifted early, adding that those who blame and shame people with the coronavirus are 'dangerous'.

item.title: Arrest after alleged Auckland level 3 restriction breach
item.description: A man is facing charges after allegedly trying to evade a police checkpoint on Auckland's southern side of the border.

item.title: Prospect of med school quotas causes alarm
item.description: Student representatives are worried proposed caps on the number of MÄori and Pasifika admissions to the University of Otago Medical School could have negative implications for decades.
